Direct message the job poster from Galls, LLC
Mario Hughley, LSSYB
Human Resources Guru | Talent Acquisition | SOP Generator | Recruitment Branding
Galls® proudly serves America’s first responders, essential workers, and military professionals with a relentless focus on customer service. With a national footprint of more than 160 locations, industry-leading e-commerce properties, and over 1,200 associates, Galls is the largest retailer specializing in military, postal, and public safety uniforms, clothing, gear, and equipment. Millions of law enforcement, military, firefighting, emergency medical, federal, postal, public transportation, corrections, security professionals, and other essential workers trust the Galls family of companies each year with how they appear every day in public and to their customers.COMPENSATION: $96,000 to $150,000 with potential for 20% BonusSUMMARY:To support the next phase of accelerated growth for Galls, we are looking for an experienced data analytics and market research leader who can build digital analytics and research function and operate it flawlessly to contribute towards our aggressive growth plans. This leader must bring a superior ability to extract actional insights from large quantities of data to advise the business leaders on a clear path to faster sales and more significant profits.Reporting to the SVP of Marketing and eCommerce, this leadership role is accountable for leading analytics primarily for the B2C eCommerce and, when required, for the B2B marketing efforts to meet aggressive growth objectives. The role will involve a mix of strategy, analytics, test and learn, and the ability to convert insights into actions in collaboration with other team members. You will have a background in delivering great analytics and insights across the web, merchandising analytics, various marketing channels, customer lifetime value, and pricing and promotion optimization. To be successful in this role, you will need to be hands-on, a thought leader in the space, and work cross-functionally with our merchandising, marketing, and inventory teams.
WHAT YOU'LL DO:eCommerce Analytics and ReportingThis leader leads and develops an analytics engine responsible for primarily driving actionable insights for Galls' eCommerce business and some non-eCom direct business channels for consumers and businesses. Responsibilities include web and site merchandising analytics (including page effectiveness, journey optimization, product and content placement optimization, site friction points, traffic, and conversion metrics, etc.), dynamic pricing, and promotional optimization, as well as detailed business metrics and KPI reporting, at daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual frequenciesCreate and execute the strategic roadmap for advancing the eCommerce analytics function by building and optimizing customer acquisition, expansion, and retention programs, campaigns, and eCommerce sales; manage digital dashboards and reporting; and guide the organization in advancing our data and analytic capabilities in a dynamically evolving digital landscapeOversee analyses across paid media (SEM), organic search (SEO), organic and paid social, digital purchase journeys, loyalty marketing, lead nurture campaigns, and reputation managementLead analyses of the digital ecosystem, including digital purchase experience, campaign analysis, lead nurture, and conversion optimization across the various website properties, landing pages, and campaigns.Architect and lead analytics strategy and roadmap to advance this function, including migration to GA4 and a “cookieless” world; the evolution of analytic infrastructure; and development of core analytical competencies (e.g., deep dive analyses, advance attribution, etc.)Oversee data analyses to extract actional insights to accelerate sales growth and profitability of several e-commerce channels across the Galls family of companiesOwn customer segmentation and manage the value segmentation process throughout the year by advising eCommerce and marketing teams on specific campaign opportunities to drive faster sales and profits.Create a test-and-learn culture to unlock value and drive continuous improvement within the customer experienceCommunicate the insights and recommendations succinctly to senior leadership with a focus on the what as opposed to the how and gain consensus to drive desired change.Market ResearchThis leader directs all market research activities for the organization to meet the business growth objectives. This leader will work closely with the SVP of Marketing and eCommerce to define priorities for external market research, develop plans and execute using internal and external resources using industry best practices.Develop and implement a market research program to meet the organization’s research needs efficiently and cost-effectively. This includes identifying and conducting primary research and analyzing secondary and syndicated researchLeverage acquired data through analyses to inform decision-making and strategy development in the organizationDevelop market performance measures that monitor economic impact in the retail industry impacting Galls and its operating companiesProduce statistical and analytical reports and forecasts on research data for use by internal and external stakeholdersProvide cooperative leadership and insights generated from the market research for the Galls; strategic planning and goal-setting processesDevelop and manage the annual market research budget, including management of market research agencies, consultants, tools, and training. Evaluates the cost-effectiveness of research toolsLeadership and CollaborationYou are expected to establish a collaborative leadership presence across the organization to allow for rapid execution against an aggressive target.Be a visible analytics leader inside Galls across all business functions and companiesMust be able to establish rapport with collaborative leadership style across as well as at all levels in the organizationEffectively lead external agencies and contractors to deliver against the business targets on time and under budgetLead the process of assisting the SVP of Marketing and eCommerce in preparing for the executive leadership and board meetings to showcase the performance of the businessUnder the guidance of the SVP of Marketing and eCommerce, deliver outstanding performance across all analytics and research expectations monthly, quarterly, and annuallyWHAT YOU BRING:Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field required (e.g., economics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or business); Master’s Degree in a data/analytic field or business preferred10+ years of experience in eCommerce analytics with excellent web/digital marketing analytics and reporting proficiencyThe ideal candidate must be highly analytical, intellectually curious, and possess the skills and acumen to translate data into actionable insights that deliver measurable results. This leader will have C-suite visibility and manage key agency/partner relationshipsProven experience with media modeling, segmentation, attribution methodologies, funnel metrics, statistical analysis, SQL, and TableauCapable of extracting data from a variety of relational databases, manipulating, and exporting using quantitative, statistical, and visualization toolsWorking knowledge of API connections to integrate third-party tools with Google Analytics and CRM platforms is a plus. Understanding of UTM codes and their appropriate use for campaign trackingAdvanced capabilities with Microsoft Excel to create complex reporting models from concept to completion (e.g., pivot tables, charts, VLOOKUP, SUMIFS, etc.)Excellent project and time management skills, with the ability to manage a portfolio of marketing analytic dashboards and projects across brands and digital channelsStrong presentation skills, including verbal presentation and formal written documents using PowerPoint and WordTools and applicationsWeb analytics (Google Analytics, Google 360, Google Tag Manager, etc.)Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)Data visualization (Tableau, Qlik, Google Data Studio)A/B testing and personalization (Google Optimize)SEM (Google Ads, SA 360, Campaign Manager, Bing ads, SEMrush, Moz, etc.)SEO (Google Search Console and Lighthouse performance tools)SQL, BigQueryWorking knowledge of Marketo, Optimove, and SurveyMonkey is a plusWHAT WE OFFER:FULL BENEFIT PACKAGE INCLUDING MEDICAL/DENTAL/VISION COVERAGELIFE AND DISABILITY INSURANCEVACATION AND PERSONAL TIMEPAID HOLIDAYS401K PLANTUITION REIMBURSEMENTEMPLOYEE DISCOUNT WHAT TO SEND OUR WAY:Your resume, highlighting your education, experience, and skillsWhy you want to be a part of the Galls familyGalls is an Equal Opportunity Employer of people from all walks of life, including persons with disabilities and veterans. Galls is passionately committed to diversity and inclusion in all that we do. We invite you to join our team, grow with us and contribute by bringing your authentic, best self to work.
